item.title: 消息人士称，字节跳动在马来西亚裁员 700 多人，转向人工智能节制
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，中国社交媒体平台 TikTok 的母公司字节跳动已从其马来西亚分公司裁员 700 多人，因为该公司已将重点转向在内容审核中更多地使用人工智能。【原文：China's ByteDance, the parent of social media platform TikTok, has laid off more than 700 workers from its Malaysian unit as the company shifts focus towards greater use of AI in content moderation, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 波音公司对罢工工会提出不公平劳动行为指控
item.description: 波音公司周四晚些时候表示，已向美国全国劳工关系委员会（National Labor Relations Board）提起对代表约 33,000 名美国西海岸工厂罢工工人的工会的不公平劳动行为指控。【原文：Boeing said late on Thursday it filed an unfair labor practice charge with the National Labor Relations Board against the union that represents about 33,000 striking U.S. West Coast factory workers.】

item.title: 投资者对中东地区可能出现的供应中断保持警惕，但石油价格有所回落
item.description: 周五，石油价格在前一天的反弹后有所回落，但仍将连续第二周上涨，因为投资者权衡了飓风破坏对美国需求的影响，以及以色列袭击伊朗石油基地是否会造成广泛的供应中断。【原文：Oil eased on Friday after a rally the previous day, but prices remained set for a second straight weekly gain as investors weighed the impact of hurricane damage on U.S. demand against any broad supply disruption if Israel attacks Iranian oil sites.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将出现五周来首次下跌，中国刺激政策备受关注
item.description: 随着中国股市的惊人涨势得到喘息，亚洲股市出现了五周以来的首次下跌，尽管所有的目光都集中在本周末中国政府备受期待的财政刺激政策的细节上。【原文：Asian shares were headed for the first weekly loss in five as the stunning rally in Chinese shares took a breather, although all eyes are on the details of the much-anticipated fiscal stimulus from Beijing this weekend.】

item.title: 交易员增加美联储减息押注，美元多头受挫
item.description: 隔夜美元兑主要货币从两个月高点回落，此前劳动力市场疲软的迹象增强了美联储加快降息的理由。【原文：The U.S. dollar fell from two-month highs hit overnight versus its major peers after signs of weakness in the labour market boosted the case for quicker Federal Reserve rate cuts.】

item.title: 经济下滑导致通胀放缓，韩国央行下调利率
item.description: 韩国央行四年半来首次下调政策利率，从抑制目前低于其 2% 目标的通胀转向关注恢复增长。【原文：South Korea's central bank cut policy interest rates for the first time in four and a half years, making a shift away from quashing inflation, currently below its 2% target, to focus on reviving growth.】

item.title: 韩国央行如期下调政策利率
item.description: 由于第二季度总体通胀放缓、经济萎缩，韩国央行周五一如市场普遍预期下调了利率，开始了与全球同行一样的宽松周期。【原文：South Korea's central bank cut interest rates on Friday as widely expected, embarking on an easing cycle to join global peers, as headline inflation slowed and the economy shrank in the second quarter.】

item.title: Citadel 的格里芬说他不支持唐纳德-特朗普竞选总统
item.description: Citadel 首席执行官肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）周四表示，他不支持唐纳德-特朗普在即将举行的美国总统大选中竞选总统。【原文：Citadel CEO Ken Griffin said on Thursday that he has not supported Donald Trump for president in the upcoming U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司将所持美国银行股份降至 10%以下
item.description: 亿万富翁沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）本周抛售了更多的美国银行股票，使其在这家美国银行业巨头的持股比例降至 10%以下。【原文：Billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway unloaded more Bank of America stock this week that takes its stake in the U.S. banking giant below 10%.】

item.title: 特斯拉马斯克将在大肆宣传和质疑声中推出机器人轴
item.description: 特斯拉公司将于本周四晚些时候在好莱坞推出承诺已久的机器人出租车，并向投资者介绍人工智能项目的最新进展，首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）曾打赌，这些努力将推动这家电动汽车制造商的长期发展。【原文：Tesla is set to unveil its long-promised robotaxi in Hollywood late on Thursday and update investors on artificial intelligence projects, efforts CEO Elon Musk has bet will drive the electric vehicle maker's long-term growth.】

item.title: 尽管存在 "法院选择 "反对意见，J&J 滑石粉破产案仍在得克萨斯州审理
item.description: 强生公司的一家子公司可以在德克萨斯州的一家破产法院进行第三次尝试，以解决数万起指控其滑石粉产品致癌的诉讼。【原文：A Johnson & Johnson subsidiary can pursue its third attempt to resolve tens of thousands of lawsuits alleging its talc products caused cancer in a Texas bankruptcy court, a judge ruled on Thursday, allowing the company to avoid a venue that shot down its two previous efforts.】

item.title: 公司表示，Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯将于 2026 年退休
item.description: 克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特周四表示，首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯将于 2026 年初合同期满时退休，目前正在寻找继任者。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis said on Thursday that CEO Carlos Tavares would retire at the end of his contract in early 2026, and the search for his successor was underway.】

item.title: 早间交易美国通胀、中国计划引发谨慎；英国央行将降息
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会敲定新的兼并申报要求
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）周四最终确定了对一项规则的修改，该规则决定了公司在为拟议中的兼并申请许可时必须交出哪些信息，从而缩减了招致行业组织批评的一项提案。【原文：The U.S Federal Trade Commission finalized changes on Thursday to a rule that determines what information companies must hand over when seeking clearance for proposed mergers, paring back a proposal that drew criticism from industry groups.】

item.title: 道明银行称 2025 年将是美国 30 亿美元罚款后的过渡年
item.description: 道明银行周四表示，将在 2025 财年重点调整资产负债表，此前该银行承认违反了美国一项旨在防止洗钱的法律，并同意支付合计 30 亿美元的罚款。【原文：TD Bank will focus on restructuring its balance sheet in the 2025 fiscal year, the bank said on Thursday, after it pleaded guilty to violating a U.S. law aimed at preventing money laundering, and agreed to pay a combined $3 billion in penalties.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空中客车公司面临来自 Spirit Aero 供应的压力
item.description: 多位业内人士表示，空中客车公司正面临着来自 Spirit AeroSystems 公司为其最大和最小喷气式飞机提供关键结构部件的问题，这也是一系列供应链问题的一部分，对交付量的增长构成了挑战。【原文：Airbus is facing concerns over supplies of key structural parts for its largest and smallest jets from Spirit AeroSystems , part of a cascade of supply chain problems challenging growth in deliveries, several industry sources said.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，CD&R 接近达成以 160 亿美元收购赛诺菲消费部门的交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，私募股权公司Clayton Dubilier & Rice (CD&R)正接近达成以约150亿欧元（164亿美元）收购赛诺菲消费保健部门的交易。【原文：Private equity firm Clayton Dubilier & Rice (CD&R) is nearing a deal to acquire Sanofi's consumer health unit for about 15 billion euros ($16.4 billion), Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国医疗机构发布 2025 年医疗保险计划质量评级结果
item.description: 美国政府周四公布了 2025 年联邦医疗保险（Medicare）医疗和处方药计划的质量评级，这是包括 CVS Health 和联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）在内的大型医疗保险公司将在 2026 年获得奖金的首个指标。【原文：The U.S. government on Thursday announced quality ratings for 2025 Medicare health and prescription drug plans, the first indication of which large health insurers including CVS Health and UnitedHealth Group will get bonus payments in 2026.】

item.title: 美国监管机构拒绝壳牌要求 Venture Global LNG 提供旧文件的请求
item.description: 壳牌周四在要求美国监管机构允许其查看与 Venture Global LNG 的卡尔卡西厄通道设施有关的非公开调试文件的申请中败诉，这是该工厂货物准入权更广泛争议中的一个挫折。【原文：Shell on Thursday lost a bid to have U.S. regulators allow it to view nonpublic commissioning documents related to Venture Global LNG's Calcasieu Pass facility, a setback in a broader dispute over access to cargoes from the plant.】

item.title: 陪审团认为拜耳必须在最新的 "Roundup "致癌案中支付 7,800 万美元
item.description: 费城一家州法院的陪审团周四裁定，拜耳公司必须向一名宾夕法尼亚州男子支付 7,800 万美元，这名男子说他因使用该公司的驱集除草剂而患上癌症。【原文：Bayer must pay $78 million to a Pennsylvania man who said he got cancer from using the company's Roundup weedkiller, a state court jury in Philadelphia found on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国官员认为道明银行 "容易成为洗钱目标
item.description: 本周四，道明银行成为美国历史上承认《银行保密法》计划失误的最大银行，也是历史上第一家承认共谋洗钱的银行。【原文：TD Bank became the largest bank in U.S. history to plead guilty to Bank Secrecy Act program failures on Thursday, and the first bank in history to plead guilty to conspiracy to commit money laundering.】

item.title: 美国司法部称，梯瓦同意支付 4.5 亿美元解决回扣指控
item.description: 美国司法部周四在一份声明中表示，总部位于新泽西州的制药商 Teva 已同意支付 4.5 亿美元，以解决其违反反回扣法规和《虚假索赔法》的指控。【原文：New Jersey-based drugmaker Teva has agreed to pay $450 million to resolve allegations that it violated an anti-kickback statute and the False Claims Act, the U.S. Justice department said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 惠誉称："米尔顿 "飓风将使 2024 年的保险损失超过 1,000 亿美元
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）在周四发布的一份报告中称，飓风米尔顿可能会给佛罗里达州的财产所有人造成高达 500 亿美元的保险损失，从而使保险公司仅在 2024 年对该州的估计损失就超过 1000 亿美元。【原文：Hurricane Milton could cause up to $50 billion in insured losses for Florida property owners, pushing insurers' estimated losses in the state over $100 billion in 2024 alone, Fitch Ratings said in a report published on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国运输部长称解决波音罢工问题日益重要
item.description: 美国交通部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周四表示，解决波音公司3.3万名工人为期四周的罢工问题日益重要，他们希望波音公司能够提供一份新的合同。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said Thursday it is increasingly important to see a resolution to a four-week old strike by 33,000 Boeing workers seeking a new contract from the planemaker.】

item.title: 纽约联储调查显示，大型银行仍预计资产负债表缩减将在春季停止
item.description: 华尔街最大的银行预计美联储将于明年 4 月结束缩减资产负债表的进程，这与它们 7 月份向央行提出的预期持平。【原文：Wall Street's biggest banks expect the Federal Reserve to end the process of shrinking its balance sheet next April, holding the line relative to what they told the central bank in July.】

item.title: PJM 发布地磁扰动警告，表示电网面临的风险有限
item.description: 美国最大的电网运营商 PJM Interconnection 周四发布了可能的地磁扰动警告，该警告可能会影响其系统至东部时间 10 月 11 日凌晨 2 点。【原文：PJM Interconnection, the largest U.S. power grid operator, on Thursday issued a possible geomagnetic disturbance warning that could impact its system through 2 a.m. Eastern Time on October 11.】

item.title: 大科技公司在俄亥俄州数据中心之争中提出电价条款
item.description: 据周四提交给监管机构的文件显示，微软、Alphabet、Meta、亚马逊和其他科技公司已就俄亥俄州数据中心如何支付电费提出了一个替代框架。【原文：Microsoft , Alphabet , Meta , Amazon and other tech firms have proposed an alternative framework for how data centers pay for power in Ohio, according to documents filed with regulators on Thursday.】

item.title: 据商业日报报道，俄罗斯将把外国公司 "退出税 "从 15%提高到 35
item.description: 俄罗斯商业日报》（RBC）周四援引三位不愿透露姓名的消息人士和一位律师的话报道称，俄罗斯当局将把离开该国的外国公司必须向国库缴纳的一次性会费从 15%提高到 35%。【原文：Russian authorities are set to raise the one-off contribution that foreign companies leaving the country must make to the state treasury to as high as 35% from 15%, the RBC business daily reported on Thursday, citing three unnamed sources and a lawyer.】

item.title: 美国监管机构通过处罚解决洗钱问题
item.description: 加拿大道明银行（TD Bank）周四同意支付合计 30 亿美元的罚款，作为与美国当局达成的和解协议的一部分，美国当局指控道明银行未能监控和防止洗钱活动。【原文：Canada's TD Bank agreed to pay a combined $3 billion in penalties on Thursday as part of a settlement with U.S. authorities over charges it failed to monitor and prevent money laundering.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体公司股价创下六周以来新高
item.description: 美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司股价周四创下六周以来的最高水平，最后上涨了约 16%，股价延续了近期的涨势。【原文：Shares of former U.S. President Donald Trump's media company hit their highest level in six weeks on Thursday and were last up about 16% as the stock extended recent gains.】
